title: Smoky chicken wraps
time: Takes 15 min to make, 20 min to cook, plus cooling and defrosting
description: This chicken recipe is ideal for freezing; just make and freeze the sauce then defrost to make fabulous wraps that are perfect for a picnic or lunch.
ingredients: 1 red pepper and 1 yellow pepper, diced
Juice of ½ lime, plus extra wedges to serve
Soured cream, diced avocado and grated Cheddar, to serve

method.Step 1: Heat the oil in a large sauté pan over a medium heat, add the chorizo and fry until crisp. Remove with a slotted spoon, turn the temperature to low, add the onion and garlic and soften for 5 minutes.

method.Step 2: Increase the heat, stir in the spices and cook for 2 minutes more. Pour in the tinned chopped tomato, then add the diced pepper and crisp chorizo. Season, bring to a simmer, then bubble for 5 minutes until thickened. Add the lime juice.

method.Step 3: Meanwhile, put the chicken in a large saucepan. Pour over the stock and bring to the boil, then simmer gently for 12-15 minutes until cooked through. Remove with a slotted spoon and discard the stock. Once it is cool enough, shred the chicken using your hands and stir it through the smoky tomato sauce. Leave to cool completely.

method.Step 4: Spoon the smoky chicken sauce into sealable plastic containers and freeze for up to 2 months.

method.Step 5: Defrost thoroughly. Leave cold, or heat until piping hot, then spoon over the flour wraps, with the spiced rice. Top with soured cream, avocado and grated Cheddar, wrap and serve.
